intro: Daviesia hakeoides f. gracilenta, commonly known as the slender Daviesia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, wiry stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its leaves are usually bipinnate, and the flowers can range in color from white to pink, depending on the specific habitat. This form is a naturally occurring variant of the species, exhibiting distinct morphological characteristics that set it apart from the typical form.
